name: Ultimate Plant-Based Sandwich
ingredients: 2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
2 tsp sriracha sauce (chilli garlic sauce) optional
preparation: Spray a non-stick skillet with olive oil and place on on medium high heat, season tofu on both sides with salt and pepper and cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden. Set aside to keep warm.
Wipe out skillet, spray with oil and add bread slices, pressing down to toast, turn and toast other side.
Spread hummus on half the toast, add avocado, sprouts, arugula, cucumber, tomato and tofu and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over sriracha if using.
Top with remaining toast, cut in half and serve.

name: Tomato Pulse Pasta Salad
ingredients: 3 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked, plus extra to serve
preparation: Cook pasta in a saucepan of salted water according to packet instructions.
Meanwhile, blend pesto ingredients in a small food processor until smooth. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Drain pasta and toss with pesto to coat.
Divide between serving bowls and top with olives and extra basil leaves to serve.

name: Crispy Chicken Tostadas
ingredients: 1 can of kidney beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 lime juiced, plus extra to serve
2 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
30g preserved jalapeno chilli peppers thinly sliced (optional)
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Arrange tortillas on sheet and bake for 15 - 20 minutes, turning halfway through, to crisp up. (Note, they will crisp up more once out of the oven.)
Meanwhile, heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Place chicken in a medium sized bowl, spray with oil and toss with spices and salt and pepper until well coated.
Cook chicken for 5 minutes both sides until golden. Wrap in foil. Seal and set aside to rest for 6 minutes before slicing thinly.
At the same time, toss beans, onion, tomato, corn and lime juice in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Divide bean mix and sliced chicken between tortillas.
Top with cheese, avocado, extra lime juice, cilantro, jalapenos (if using) and drizzle over yogurt to serve

name: Open Tempeh Reuben Sandwich
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
30g cheddar cheese thinly sliced or grated
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine vinegar, mustard and maple syrup in a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Add tempeh, toss well to coat and leave to marinate for a few minutes.
Remove tempeh from marinade, reserving remaining marinade, and arrange on baking sheet. Cook for 15 minutes, turn over, and cook for another 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat, spray with oil and saute onion for a few minutes, until softened. Stir through remaining marinade and cook for a few more minutes. Set aside.
To assemble, top hot toast with cheese, onion, arugula, tempeh, sauerkraut and a scattering of parsley. Season to taste and serve.

name: French Onion Soup with Cheesy Croutons
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped
1 cup (200g) dried puy lentils well rinsed & picked over
60g sourdough baguette (or gluten free) thinly sliced
preparation: Heat butter in a medium sized saucepan over medium-low heat. Add onions, garlic and thyme and cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes or until soft and very lightly browned.
At the same time, bring a medium saucepan of salted water to the boil. Add lentils and simmer for approximately 12 minutes until almost cooked. Drain and set aside.
Add vinegar to the onions, mixing well, to deglaze the bottom of the saucepan.
Add cooked lentils and stock and simmer for a further 5 minutes or until lentils are just cooked but not mushy. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper.
At the same time, broil one side of the bread for 1-2 minutes until lightly golden. Sprinkle as much cheese as possible over the uncooked side, return to the broiler and cook until cheese has melted.
Ladle soup into serving bowls and top with cheesy baguette slices, extra cheese and extra black pepper to serve.

name: Grab & Go Broccoli Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 2 cups (360g) pre-cooked quinoa cooked according to packet directions
2 cans of cannellini beans (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
1 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & roughly chopped
1 cayenne chilli pepper or more, deseeded & chopped
preparation: Place broccoli in a bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside for 5 minutes.
At the same time cook quinoa according to packet directions.
To make dressing, whisk oil, lemon zest and juice together and season with salt and pepper.
Drain broccoli, pat dry and toss with quinoa, beans, mint, chilli and dressing and season to taste.
Divide between bowls and serve immediately or divide between containers, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Use within 3 days.

name: Roast Chicken & Avocado Open Sandwich
ingredients: 1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Combine chicken, yogurt and salt and pepper to taste in a bowl and mix well.
Spray a small non-stick skillet with oil and cook onion over medium heat for about 6-7 minutes, being careful not to burn, until golden. Set aside.
Place tomatoes, vinegar and honey in a small bowl, mix well and season to taste.
Layer toast with avocado, chicken, onion and tomatoes. Top with basil leaves to serve.

name: Taco Salad Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of kidney beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 1⁄2 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper)
1⁄2 cup (80g) microwave brown rice cooked according to packet directions
preparation: Wrap tofu in paper towel and press under a weight (eg.tins of beans on a board) to remove excess water. Cut into slices, then triangles.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add tofu and cook for 6 minutes, turning half way through, until golden and set aside.
In same skillet, add beans, spice and water, season with salt and pepper and mix well. Cook for a few minutes until warmed through and thickened.
Place rice in serving bowl. Arrange beans, avocado, tomatoes, cucumber and tofu around the bowl and season with salt and pepper. Squeeze over lime and serve with corn chips.

name: Quick Couscous Lunch Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup couscous (or gluten free couscous or cooked brown rice if gluten free)
1⁄4 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Method for Jar:    Place couscous and chickpeas in a heatproof jar with a lid and season with salt and pepper.
When ready to eat, add boiling water, cover and leave to stand for 10 minutes. You may need to add a little more boiling water, depending on your couscous.
Fluff with a fork, add bell pepper and olives and stir through.
Top with feta and basil to serve.
Method for Salad Bowl: Place couscous and chickpeas in a heatproof bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Pour over boiling water, cover with cling wrap and stand for 10 minutes or until all the water has been absorbed.
Fluff with a fork, add bell pepper and olives and stir through.
Top with feta and basil to serve.

name: Chicken Pita Salad with Pesto
ingredients: 2 medium (2 1/2 oz ea) wholewheat pita pockets (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Spray wraps with oil and cook for a few minutes each side until golden.
Meanwhile toss chicken, carrot, peas and spinach with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
Tear cooked wrap into pieces and toss with salad.
Transfer to a serving bowl and serve with pesto.

name: Quinoa, Chickpea & Sweet Potato Buddha Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss sweet potato with salt and pepper, place on sheet and bake for 30 minutes, turning halfway.
In a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat, add chickpeas, turmeric and cumin. Add a small amount of water to distribute the spices evenly and cook until slightly crispy and browned. Set aside.
Add kale to the skillet and cook until softened.
To make the dressing, whisk ingredients in a shallow bowl until combined and season with salt and pepper.
Arrange quinoa, sweet potatoes and chickpeas in a serving bowl and drizzle over dressing.
Scatter over chilli flakes or any fresh herb for an extra flavor boost.

name: Turkey, Feta & Spinach Wrap
ingredients: 2 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Spread mustard over wraps and top with spinach, turkey and feta and season with salt and pepper.
Roll up, tucking in the ends. Wrap in foil to secure and refrigerate until ready to eat.

name: Honey Soy Tofu with Greens & Quinoa
ingredients: 2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 cup (180g) pre-cooked quinoa cooked according to packet directions
preparation: Combine soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, salt and pepper in a shallow dish or sealable container. Add tofu and gently stir or shake to combine. Transfer to the fridge and marinate for at least 30 minutes, tossing after 15 minutes.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat and toast sesame seeds for a few minutes until golden. Set aside.
Add tofu to skillet and cook 3-4 minutes each side, until golden brown. Remove from skillet and set aside in a warm place.
Turn heat to low, add the leftover marinade and simmer for 2-3 minutes to reduce until it has become a sticky glaze. Add a dash of water if it is reducing too quickly!
Place spinach in a bowl, add a pinch of salt and cover with boiling water. Stand for 30-40 seconds until wilted then drain.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and tofu in a serving bowl, drizzle over sauce and top with sesame seeds to serve.

name: Falafel & Sweet Potato Wrap
ingredients: 60g sweet potatoes thinly sliced into ribbons with a vegetable peeler
1 large (3 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Spray sweet potato ribbons with oil and cook a few minutes each side until softened. Set aside.
Warm pita pocket in the same pan for a few minutes to soften.
At the same time, heat falafel in microwave for 1 ½-2 minutes or until warmed through.
Split the top of the pita pocket open and spread with hummus.
Add arugula, sweet potato ribbons, falafel, a squeeze of lemon, chilli (if using) and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Roast Veggie Salad with Cashew Dressing
ingredients: 500g brussels sprouts halved or quartered, if large
2 cans of lentils (14 oz cans) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 tsp chilli flakes or more to taste
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss vegetables with oil, spices and salt and pepper.
Spread over baking sheet and roast for 35-40 minutes or until they are fork tender. Push vegetables to one side and add lentils to the sheet for the last 10 minutes of cooking.
At the same time, make the dressing. In a high-powered blender, add all ingredients and blend on high for at least 2 minutes. Adding extra water, a little at a time as needed, until smooth.
Store refrigerated in a jar for up to a week.

name: Beef & Soba Noodle Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) mung bean sprouts well rinsed
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Bring a saucepan of water to the boil. Add noodles, making sure they are fully submerged, and cook for 2-3 minutes until just cooked. Drain and set aside.
Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.

Rub steak with half the oil and add to the hot skillet. Without turning, cook for 3 minutes or until golden. Turn and cook the other side for another 2 minutes. Set aside to rest for 5 minutes before slicing against the grain.
Add remaining oil to the skillet over medium heat. Add vegetables, garlic and ginger and saute for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce and honey and bring to a simmer.
Toss through steak and noodles and divide between bowls to serve.
Salad may be eaten warm or chilled.

name: Chickpea & Edamame Power Bowl
ingredients: 1 head of baby romaine lettuce chopped
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 mini (1 oz) wholegrain pita bread (or gluten-free) warmed
preparation: Whisk tahini and lemon juice together in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Add lettuce, tomatoes, edamame and chickpeas and toss well.
Transfer to a serving bowl, top with pepitas and serve with warm pita bread.

name: Tuna Melt Wrap
ingredients: 1 tsp English mustard or up to 1 tbs, depending on taste
2 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Place a medium non-stick skillet on medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper and cook for 3-4 minutes until soft and translucent.
Add spinach and cook for a few minutes to wilt. Transfer to a plate and set aside to cool.
Combine tuna, pickle, sauerkraut and mustard in a bowl and mix well. Stir through cooked vegetables and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a skillet or sandwich press over medium heat and warm wraps for a minute to soften. Remove from skillet.
Add cheese, tomato and tuna mix to wrap and roll up. Cook in hot skillet for 4 minutes each side or until golden and cheese has melted. Cut in half to serve.

name: Falafel & Quinoa Bowl
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) pre-cooked quinoa cooked according to packet directions
2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free) cut into triangles
preparation: Cook falafel according to packet directions and set aside.
In a medium bowl whisk lemon juice, oil, chilli, salt and pepper together. Add remaining  salad ingredients and toss.
Divide salad and quinoa between bowls and top with falafels, pita and hummus to serve.

name: Mexican-Inspired Buddha Bowl with Guacamole
ingredients: 1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) finely chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Whilst rice is cooking, combine beans with oil in a baking dish, mix well to coat. Add spices, season with salt and pepper and toss to evenly coat in spices. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until crispy.
At the same time, scatter bell pepper over baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes.
To make the guacamole, combine all ingredients in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Once everything has cooked through, it’s time to build your bowl. Divide rice between bowls, add beans, bell pepper and guacamole. Top with almonds, cilantro sprigs and squeeze over lime to serve.

name: Smashed White Bean & Avocado Toast
ingredients: 1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) rye bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Place spinach in a sieve and pour over boiling water until wilted. Drain well and roughly chop.
Place beans and mustard in a bowl and roughly mash together.
Stir through spinach and season with salt and pepper.
Spread over toast, top with avocado and squeeze over lemon juice to serve.

name: Smoky Chickpea & Chorizo Flatbread
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 large (3 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free)
preparation: Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook chorizo for 5 minutes, turning once, until crisp around the edges. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towel.
Add chickpeas and paprika to skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes until hot. Remove with a slotted spoon and toss with chorizo.
Spread pita with hummus, scatter over chorizo and chickpeas and top with yogurt and parsley to serve.

name: Salted Caramel Super Smoothie
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (200ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.

name: Peach Cobbler Super Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
1 yellow peach, medium or any other fresh or tinned peach
preparation: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.

name: Turkey Power Bowl with Brussels Sprouts & Sesame Tahini
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh cilantro leaves picked (optional)
1⁄2 lemon cut into wedges, to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and line baking dish with baking paper.
Place rice, water and salt in a medium saucepan and simmer, covered for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.
Toss brussels sprouts with oil and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to baking dish and roast for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Set aside.
At the same time, toast sesame seeds in the oven in a small dish for a few minutes until golden. Set aside.
Meanwhile, place a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Cook turkey for 10-12 minutes, breaking up larger pieces, or until browned.
Add vinegar and season with salt and pepper.
Place dressing ingredients in a small jar. Season with salt and pepper and shake well to combine.
Divide rice, brussels sprouts and turkey between bowls and drizzle over dressing.
Top with scallion, chilli pepper, cilantro and sesame seeds and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Epic Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) rinsed & patted dry
1 little gem lettuce (5 oz head) (or baby romaine)
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) picked & torn
1 cup (180g) pre-cooked quinoa cooked according to packet instructions
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a small shallow baking dish with baking paper.
Add chickpeas, oil and chilli flakes to baking dish and season with salt and pepper. Toss well to coat and roast for 15 minutes. Add pepitas, toss and cook for another 5 minutes or until crispy.
For the dressing, combine oil, vinegar, chilli and salt and pepper in a jar, shake well and set aside.
In a large bowl, toss greens, mint, tomatoes, cucumber and quinoa together. Scatter over chickpeas and pepitas, feta and toss with dressing to serve.

name: Steak Tostada
ingredients: 300g flat iron steak or leftover steak
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place tortillas on sheet and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5 minutes, or until golden around the edges and crisp.

Meanwhile, heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Season steak with salt and pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes each side, or until cooked to your liking. Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
Add corn to skillet and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes until slightly charred and just cooked. (If using leftover steak, simply slice and warm in skillet with corn for 2 minutes).
Whisk yogurt with lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
To serve, slice steak thinly and arrange on tostada. Add corn and tomatoes, season and top with yogurt and cilantro to serve.

name: Colorful Chickpea Veggie Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 1⁄4 cups (225g) pre-cooked quinoa cooked according to packet directions
3 sprigs of fresh cilantro roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 410°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place carrots and cauliflower in a bowl, spray with oil and toss with coriander and salt and pepper. Arrange on half of the sheet and roast for 15 minutes.

Add chickpeas to the bowl, spray with oil and toss with cumin and salt and pepper. Add to the other half of the sheet and cook chickpeas and vegetables for 20 minutes. Toss chickpeas and vegetables separately half way through.
Divide vegetables, chickpeas and quinoa between bowls and top with almonds and cilantro to serve.

name: Mexican Shrimp Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Preheat a BBQ or non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
Brush corn with half the oil and cook on BBQ, turning, for 6-8 minutes or until lightly charred and cooked. Set aside to cool, then slice kernels from the cob.
Toss shrimp with remaining oil, paprika and salt and pepper.
Barbecue for 1-2 minutes each side until just cooked. Transfer to a plate.
Combine corn, beans, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, cilantro, lime juice and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer salad to a serving plate and top with shrimp to serve.

name: Quick Slaw with Spiced Chickpeas
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Pat chickpeas dry with paper towel and toss with oil, curry powder and nutritional yeast.
Transfer to a small saucepan over medium heat and cook stirring for 3-4 minutes until fragrant. Set aside to cool.
Combine rice, cabbage, carrot, cilantro and lemon juice in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and toss well.
Scatter over chickpeas and top with yogurt to serve.

name: Salt & Pepper Tofu Salad
preparation: Cook noodles according to packet instructions. Drain, toss with oil and set aside.
Meanwhile, place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as you can. Cut into large cubes.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook tofu for 4-5 minutes, turning as each side browns.
Mix salt, spice and pepper together in a bowl and toss with cooked tofu.
Add lettuce, noodles and tofu to a bowl. Top with chilli and scallion and squeeze over lime to serve.

name: Grilled Zucchini & Lentil Salad
ingredients: 1 zucchini (medium) cut into 3/4 inch slices diagonally
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
3 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked, plus extra to serve
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Grill zucchini for 3-5 minutes each side, until charred and tender. Season and set aside.
Whisk dressing ingredients together in a large bowl and season.
Add zucchini, lentils, feta, tomatoes, onion & basil to the bowl of dressing and toss to combine.
Serve salad topped with extra basil leaves.

name: Bali Buddha Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped & chopped
1 1⁄2 cups (240g) brown & wild rice, pre-cooked blend cooked according to packet directions
1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 cup (60ml) soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free) or coconut aminos
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 1⁄2 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Place kale in a medium bowl, submerge in boiling water and cover with a saucer or cling film. Drain after 5 minutes and pat dry.
Meanwhile, to make satay sauce, whisk all ingredients in a bowl. Adjust seasoning, adding a little more soy if too thick and set aside.
Add rice to serving bowls and top with kale, carrot, avocado, chickpeas and pepitas.
Drizzle over satay sauce to serve.

name: Smoked Salmon, Pickle & Dill Sandwich
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
preparation: Spread one slice of bread with cottage cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Top with tomato, onion, salmon, gherkin, dill and remaining slice of bread. Cut in half to serve.

name: Cypriot Tofu Salad
ingredients: 1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover tofu with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as you can. Cut into small cubes.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add tofu and cook, turning after a few minutes, for 5-6 minutes until golden. Transfer to a large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine and serve.

name: Ham & Mustard Wrap
ingredients: 2 small (1 ½ oz ea) wholegrain/wholewheat wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Spread wraps with mustard, top with spinach, ham, cheese and tomato. Season with salt and pepper and wrap tightly.
Place wraps in a sandwich press and cook for 5 minutes until cheese has melted and wraps are golden brown.

name: Roast Vegetable Salad
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (135g) microwave brown rice and quinoa cooked according to packet directions
preparation: Toss roasted vegetables together with rice and quinoa, arugula, lemon juice and zest and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a bowl and top with goat’s cheese and pepitas to serve.

name: Shredded Brussels Sprouts Salad with Cranberries & Black Rice
ingredients: 250g brussels sprouts finely shredded with a mandolin
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped
2 scallions thinly shredded with a mandolin
preparation: Place rice, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 30 - 35 minutes until rice is tender and most of the water has been absorbed. Remove from heat and rest for 5-10 minutes.
Spread rice on a plate to cool slightly then toss in a bowl with brussels sprouts.
Add mint, scallions, lemon juice and cranberries, season with salt and pepper and toss well to combine. Scatter over hazelnuts to serve.

name: Butter Bean Nicoise Salad
ingredients: 80g green beans trimmed & cut in half
1 can of butter beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Cook potatoes in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 10 minutes. Add green beans and cook for a further 2 minutes until potatoes are tender. Drain and cool slightly.
Whisk vinegar, oil, nutritional yeast and mustard in a large bowl.
Add potatoes, green beans, butter beans, tomatoes and olives and gently toss with dressing. Top with walnuts and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Grilled Zucchini & Hummus Wrap
ingredients: 2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free)
4 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Heat a non-stick griddle pan or BBQ over medium heat. Grill zucchini for 2-3 minutes each side until charred and tender.
At the same time, spread hummus onto pita.
Add bell pepper, grilled zucchini and season with salt and pepper.  Scatter over dukkah and mint to serve.

name: Roast Chicken Wrap
ingredients: 1 large (3 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free)
preparation: Spread pita with pesto and arrange arugula, carrot, tomato, chicken and cheese down the centre.
Season and fold bottom of pita up, wrap in the sides and serve.

name: Chicken BLT Salad
ingredients: 2 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholemeal sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted & diced into croutons
preparation: Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and cook for 4 minutes until crisp. Remove from heat.
Combine dressing ingredients in a small bowl and whisk to combine.
Place lettuce in serving bowl and top with bacon, chicken, tomatoes, avocado and toasted croutons. Season to taste and serve with dressing.

name: Artichoke, Pesto & Arugula Sandwich
ingredients: 4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
4 artichoke hearts in brine drained & cut in half
preparation: Mix pesto and cheese in a small bowl until combined.
Spread half the slices of bread with cheese mixture, layer arugula, tomato and artichoke and season with salt and pepper. Top with remaining slices of bread, cut in half and serve.

name: Asian Salad with Peanut Sauce
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Place edamame in a heat-proof bowl and cover with boiling water. Allow to stand for 2 minutes, drain and refresh under cold water. Drain again and pat dry with paper towel. Transfer to a large bowl.
To make sauce, place all ingredients in a bowl and whisk until combined.
Add quinoa, carrot, cabbage, cilantro, lime juice and sauce to edamame and toss well. Adjust seasoning.
Divide between bowls and scatter over peanuts to serve.

name: Lunch Box Zucchini Fritters
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (35g) panko breadcrumbs (or gluten-free if required)
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
100g broccoli cut in small florets & blanched
1⁄4 cup (60g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
4 medium (3 oz ea) wholewheat pita breads or pockets (or gluten free) warmed
30g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Place zucchini in a clean tea-towel or paper towel and squeeze as much liquid out as possible. Mix all fritter ingredients, except oil and honey, and form into 8 patties.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook fritters for 4 minutes, turning half way through, until golden brown. Place on paper towel to drain any excess oil. Drizzle over honey and season with salt.
Serve fritters with vegetables, almond butter, bocconcini and warm pita bread followed by raspberries and chocolate.

name: Roast Vegetable Salad with Falafel
ingredients: 2 sprigs of parsley leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss sweet potato and beets with oil and season with salt and pepper. Scatter over baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes.
Add falafels to sheet of vegetables and bake for a further 10 minutes until heated through.
At the same time, blend cottage cheese, yogurt and lemon juice together in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Divide cabbage, sweet potato, beets and falafel between bowls, scatter over parsley and serve with yogurt sauce.

name: Apple, Walnut & Celery Salad
ingredients: 1 cup (160g) microwave brown rice and quinoa
1 celery stalk thinly sliced and leaves reserved
preparation: Gently toss apples and half the lemon juice in a medium bowl and set aside.
To make the dressing, combine ingredients with remaining lemon juice and season to taste.
Add rice, cabbage, onion, celery and walnuts to the apples, toss and season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to serving bowl, drizzle over dressing and top with celery leaves to serve.

name: Leftover Turkey & Crispy Bacon Wrap
ingredients: 2 small (1 1/2 oz ea) spinach wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
preparation: Place bacon in a small non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until crispy.
Spread mayonnaise over wraps and top with lettuce, tomato and turkey and season with salt and pepper. Scatter over crispy bacon, wrap and serve.

name: Squash & Fennel Wraps with Cilantro Pesto
ingredients: 2 small (1 1/2 oz ea) spinach wraps or tortillas (or gluten free)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves & stems roughly chopped to make 1/2 cup
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place squash and fennel slices on baking sheet, season with salt and pepper and bake for 20 minutes or until the squash is very soft and fennel is soft and golden brown.

To make the pesto, process cilantro, sunflower kernels, yeast and garlic in a food processor to a rough paste. With the motor running, gradually add water and oil and process until combined. Adjust seasoning.
Spread wraps with hummus, top with spinach leaves, roast squash and fennel and drizzle with pesto. Roll up and serve.

name: Broccolini Salad with Tahini Dressing
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) cut in half lengthways
1⁄2 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Place broccolini in a bowl, add sufficient boiling water to submerge and cover with a saucer or cling wrap. Set aside for 5 minutes. Drain, refresh in cold water, drain and pat dry.
To make the dressing, whisk all the ingredients together until smooth, adding more water if necessary.
Toss lentils and quinoa together in a serving bowl. Add spinach, tomatoes and avocado. Top with pepitas, season to taste and drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Coconut Chicken Lettuce Cups
ingredients: 1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
1 lime half juiced, half in wedges to serve
preparation: To make the dressing, mix together all the ingredients in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper.

Arrange lettuce leaves on a serving plate. Toss chicken, cucumber and rice together, season and divide between lettuce leaves. Drizzle over dressing, top with cilantro leaves and serve with lime wedges.

name: Chopped Vegetable Salad
ingredients: 150g broccoli cut into small florets & roughly diced
1 large (3 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free) warmed
preparation: Place broccoli in a small bowl and pour over boiling water to cover. Cover with plastic wrap and stand for 2-3 minutes. Drain and pat dry.
To make the dressing, whisk all ingredients together until combined and season to taste.
In a large bowl, combine broccoli, carrot, tomato, cucumber, avocado and dressing and gently toss.
Transfer to a serving bowl, top with almonds and serve with warm pita bread.

name: Salmon, Edamame & Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) trimmed & cut into thirds
1 small green chilli pepper thinly sliced
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place salmon on baking sheet, season with salt and pepper and bake for 12 minutes, or until just cooked.
Meanwhile, blanch broccolini and edamame in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 2-3 minutes until crisp tender. Drain, refresh under cold water and pat dry.
Combine vegetables with quinoa, lemon zest, lemon juice, chilli, cilantro and avocado in a large bowl, gently toss and transfer to a serving bowl.
Flake salmon into pieces and arrange over salad. Scatter over sesame seeds and serve.

name: Asian Chicken & Rice Noodle Salad
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Cook noodles according to packet instructions (about 10 minutes). Drain and spread on a plate to cool.
In a medium bowl whisk dressing ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
Add remaining ingredients including noodles and gently toss to combine. Transfer to bowl and serve.

name: Roasted Chickpea & Cauliflower Salad with Dukkah
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line two baking sheets with baking paper.

Dry chickpeas with paper towel and transfer to a bowl. Add cauliflower, spray with oil and toss with cumin and salt and pepper and scatter over the baking trays. Roast for 30 minutes or until golden. Remove from the oven and toss with half the dukkah.
Whisk dressing ingredients together and season to taste.
Divide between plates, drizzle with dressing and scatter over almonds, parsley, remaining dukkah and chilli flakes to serve.

name: Greek Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can of cannellini beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Whisk vinegar, olive oil, oregano, salt and pepper in a large bowl to combine.
Add tomatoes, green bell pepper, cucumber, onion and beans and mix well. Adjust seasoning.
Transfer to a serving bowl and top with olives, feta and parsley to serve.

name: Broccolini & Goat's Cheese Frittata with Greens
ingredients: 1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) sliced lengthways
2 brown shallots peeled & very thinly sliced
1 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked & roughly chopped
1 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Pre-heat oven to 390°F.
Whisk eggs and thyme in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Heat olive oil in an oven-proof non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add broccolini and cook to colour slightly.
Turn heat down to medium, add egg mixture and crumble over goat’s cheese. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 5 minutes.
Toss salad ingredients together and season with salt and pepper.
Turn frittata out of skillet onto a board and cut into wedges. Top with parmesan, chives and chilli flakes and serve with herb salad.

name: Baked Beet & Berries Salad with Goat's Cheese
ingredients: 2 tbs (40ml) balsamic vinegar or raspberry vinegar
3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
4 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F.

Wrap each beet in aluminium foil and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until cooked. Set aside until cool enough to handle and rub skins off with a tea-towel, saving any juice as you peel. (Good idea to wear gloves) Cut into thin slices.
Whisk vinegar, oil, honey, zest, juice and salt in a bowl. Add beet slices and juice and gently mix with dressing. Set aside for 2 minutes, then strain beets.
Gently toss beets with berries and pistachios, top with cheese and herbs and season with salt and pepper. Best served at room temperature.

name: Falafel Pita with Hummus
ingredients: 1 medium (2 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita pocket (or gluten free) top split open
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place falafels on prepared baking tray and bake for 10-15 minutes until golden and heated through.
Meanwhile, mix hummus with cottage cheese and spread inside pita pocket.
Toss spinach, tomato, onion and parsley together and season with salt and pepper.  Add salad and falafels to pita pocket and serve.

name: Potato, Cauliflower & Pea Soup with Edamame
ingredients: 2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
2 tsp black sesame seeds or white
preparation: Place potato, cauliflower, spring onions and stock into a large saucepan. Bring to the boil, reduce to a simmer, cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are soft.
Add peas and cook for a few minutes to heat through. Blend soup until smooth.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over low heat. Add edamame, sesame seeds and chilli and cook for 3 minutes or until warmed through. Season with salt and pepper.
Divide soup between bowls, top with Sesame Edamame and serve with toast.

name: Harissa Carrot Salad & Yogurt Dressing
ingredients: 1 bunch of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch)
1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place harissa and water in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
Add carrots and chickpeas and toss to coat. Place on baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until golden.
In a small bowl mix cottage cheese and yogurt, season with salt and pepper and divide between serving bowls.
Place quinoa, spinach leaves and lemon juice in a large bowl. Add cooked carrots and chickpeas, season with salt and pepper and toss to combine.
Divide carrot and chickpea mixture between serving bowls and scatter over almonds to serve.

name: Beets & Cabbage Slaw with Maple Walnuts
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
3 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat, add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until onion is soft. Add beets and cabbage and cook for 3 minutes or until just tender, you still want a bit of crunch. Set aside.
Add balsamic, maple syrup and lentils and cook for a few minutes or until the lentils are warmed through.
To make maple walnuts, heat maple syrup in skillet, add walnuts and salt and cook until sticky, around 2-3 minutes. Don’t stir too much or it will clump together.
Divide slaw between bowls, then top with carrots, mint leaves and maple walnuts.

name: Roasted Cauliflower with Pickled Grapes & Hazelnuts
ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) with leaves
2 brown shallots peeled and finely sliced
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) leaves picked
1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 445°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place hazelnuts on baking sheet and roast for 5 minutes and set aside.

Toss cauliflower and leaves with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes, until lightly browned. Allow to cool and cut cauliflower into small florets and slice the leaves. Set aside.

To pickle the grapes, heat a heavy-based pan until very hot. Add grapes and shake them around the pan for 10 seconds until they are blistering and being scorched. Add vinegar and continue to shake grapes around the pan for 5-10 seconds.
To make the dressing, whisk vinegar, honey, mustard, lemon juice and salt. Slowly drizzle in the oil and continue to whisk until emulsified.

In a large mixing bowl, place the florets, hazelnuts, pickled grapes, shallots and parsley. Pour over the dressing and season with salt and pepper. Gently mix the salad, place it into a serving bowl and season with sumac.
Divide between plates and serve.

name: Curried Sweet Potato & Avocado Buddha Bowl
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked & chopped
1 small green chilli pepper finely chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine sweet potato, chickpeas, lentils and cashews in a bowl. Add oil and toss to coat. Gently stir through curry powder and season with salt and pepper.
Spread onto prepared sheet and bake for 30 minutes, or until sweet potato is cooked.
To make dressing, combine ingredients, mix well and season to taste.
Divide spinach leaves between bowls, top with sweet potato mixture and avocado and drizzle with dressing to serve.

name: Tomato & Leek Vegan Quiche
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & chopped
3 small (1 3/4oz) wholegrain/wholewheat (or gluten free) rolls warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line an 8 inch square baking dish with baking paper.
Heat oil in a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add leek and cook, stirring for 5-8 minutes until soft. Remove from heat.

Meanwhile, place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover tofu with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as you can. Transfer to a food processor. Add hummus, flour, nutritional yeast and blend until smooth.
Reserve 1⁄3 of the tomatoes and 1⁄3 of the leek for topping. Add remaining tomato and leek and herbs to tofu mixture, season with salt and pepper and mix to combine.
Transfer to baking dish and top with reserved tomato and leek. Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden brown and set, then cool for 10 minutes before slicing.
Drizzle salad with lemon juice, season with salt and pepper and serve with quiche and warm rolls.

name: Son-in-law Eggs
ingredients: 2 small red chilli peppers thinly sliced
6 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, cool and peel.

Fill a wok or saucepan one-third full with oil and heat over medium heat to 335°F (or until a cube of bread turns golden in 15 seconds). Working in batches, cook eggs for 5 minutes or until golden and a crust has formed. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towel.
Add dried red chillies to wok and cook for 1 minute or until fragrant. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towel. Drain oil from wok.

For the Tamarind Sauce, heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add shallots and cook, stirring, for 12 minutes or until softened and reduced by half in volume. Add sugar, tamarind and fish sauce and cook stirring continuously to dissolve sugar, about 4 minutes, and sauce is a light caramel colour.
Cut eggs in half and place on a serving plate. Top with sauce and scatter over fried chilli, shallots, sliced chilli and cilantro.
Toss salad leaves with oil and lime juice, season with salt and pepper and serve with eggs.

name: Mango, Coconut & Tofu Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 Lebanese cucumber shaved into noodles or ribbons
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro finely chopped
preparation: Soak noodles in hot water according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside to cool.
Meanwhile, place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover tofu with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb excess water. Cut into small cubes.
Place coconut in a small dry skillet over medium heat. Toss for 1-2 minutes until toasted and set aside.
Add tofu to skillet and cook, turning only after a few minutes and continue to cook until golden. Set aside to cool.
Arrange noodles on serving plate and top with cucumber, mango, tofu, sauerkraut, cilantro and chilli pepper. Drizzle over lime juice, season and scatter over toasted coconut to serve.

name: Roast Parsnip, Halloumi & Walnut Salad
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 Granny Smith apple cored & thinly sliced
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a large baking sheet with baking paper.

Place oil and maple syrup in a large bowl and whisk to combine. Add parsnip, walnuts and halloumi and toss to coat. Arrange parsnip on baking sheet and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 15-20 minutes. Add walnuts and halloumi to sheet and roast for a further 5 minutes until golden and parsnips are tender. Allow to cool on sheet to room temperature.
Meanwhile, place arugula, apple and lemon juice in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine and divide between serving plates. Top with parsnip, halloumi and walnuts to serve.

name: Korean Lunch Bowl
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Simmer for 5 minutes, remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in half.
Add rice to serving bowl and top with edamame, kimchi, cabbage, radish and eggs, scatter over sesame seeds and season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Radicchio, Grapefruit & Tuna Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 pink grapefruit peeled, segmented & 2 tsp juice reserved
185g canned tuna in springwater drained & flaked
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
preparation: Arrange radicchio on serving plate. Scatter over grapefruit, avocado, tuna, quinoa and cilantro.
Whisk reserved grapefruit juice and oil together and season with salt and pepper, to taste. Drizzle over salad and serve.

name: Teriyaki Mushroom Rice Paper Rolls
preparation: Combine sauce ingredients in a bowl, stirring well, and set aside.
Combine quinoa and edamame in a bowl.

Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over high heat, add mushrooms and sesame seeds and stir fry for 5 minutes or until soft and browned and no moisture is left in the pan. Add teriyaki marinade and cook for 3 minutes. Remove from pan.
Working with one sheet of rice paper at a time, immerse the rice paper in a shallow bowl of warm water until the rice paper is just soft.

Lay the soaked rice paper sheet on a clean tea towel on a chopping board. Top with 1 heaped tablespoon of quinoa edamame mix, some teriyaki mushrooms, carrot and lettuce. Roll up, folding in the sides, cover and keep moist using a piece of damp kitchen paper and prepare the remaining rolls.
Serve rice paper rolls with dipping sauce.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad with Chunky Olive Tapenade
ingredients: 4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Place quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, arugula and capers into a bowl and mix to combine.
To make tapenade, roughly chop olives, pepitas and basil. Transfer to a bowl and toss with remaining ingredients.
To serve, top bowl of quinoa salad with tapenade and season to taste.

name: Broccoli Fritter with Pea & Avocado Salsa
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh mint leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Whisk together chia seeds and water, allow to stand for a few minutes or until it forms a gel.
To make salsa, combine ingredients in a bowl, season with salt and pepper and set aside.

Grate broccoli and zucchini into a bowl and combine with scallions, flour, nutritional yeast and mint.
Season, stir through chia gel and extra water and mix well to combine.

Heat half the oil in an 8 inch non-stick skillet over a medium heat. Add batter, spreading around the skillet with the back of a wet spoon. (The smaller the skillet, the more likely the mixture will be to hold together.) Cook for 5 minutes or until the base is golden brown. Cover and cook for 3-5 minutes. Place a plate over the skillet and turn the fritter out onto the plate.
Add remaining oil to skillet, slide the fritter back in and cook the other side for 5 minutes or until golden.
Serve fritter topped with avocado salsa.
Tip: Use a good non-stick skillet, otherwise make small fritters. If the large fritter is hard to turn then cook a minute or two longer.

name: Tuna Salad Sandwich
ingredients: 4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
preparation: Place tuna, yogurt, celery, shallot, dill and lemon juice in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper and mix to combine.
Spread tuna salad onto two slices of bread. Top with lettuce and sandwich with remaining slice of bread. Cut in half and serve.

name: Charred Broccoli Salad with Pancetta, Mint & Almonds
ingredients: 1 thin (1 1/2 oz ) sourdough bread (or gluten free) torn into pieces
1 head of broccoli (12 oz head) stalk & head, sliced
1 head of romaine lettuce leaves torn
1 apple green, cored & cut into matchsticks
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
1 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch)
preparation: Add oil to a non-stick skillet and cook pancetta and torn bread over medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes until golden and crispy. Remove from skillet and set aside.

Add all the broccoli stalks to the skillet and chargrill for 4-5 minutes. Remove and set aside. Add remaining broccoli florets to the skillet and cook for a few minutes to char slightly. Set aside to cool and roughly chop.
Blend cooled broccoli stalks with dressing ingredients until smooth.
Toss lettuce with apple, pancetta, chopped broccoli and dressing. Season with salt and pepper and top with croutons, almonds and parmesan to serve.

name: Tempeh Wrap with Avocado & Pomegranate
ingredients: 160g plain tempeh cut into 1/2 inch slices
1⁄4 bunch of swiss chard (1 1/2 lb bunch) stalk removed, washed & dried
preparation: Place tempeh on a plate and sprinkle with cumin on both sides. Heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook tempeh for 2 minutes each side until golden. Remove from heat.

Place tortilla on a board and place swiss chard leaves over the top to cover. Spoon beetroot hummus down the middle of the wrap and arrange tempeh and avocado over the top. Sprinkle with pomegranate seeds and fold up. Serve.

name: Buddha Bowl with Sauerkraut
ingredients: 1⁄2 tsp Cajun seasoning plus extra to serve (optional)
preparation: Place tofu on a plate lined with paper towel. Cover tofu with more paper towel and press down gently to absorb as much liquid as you can. Cut into small cubes and toss with spice.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add tofu and cook, turning, for 5-6 minutes until golden.
Arrange cooked tofu, quinoa, sauerkraut, tomatoes, sugar snap peas and edamame in seperate sections in a serving bowl. Season with extra spice and salt and pepper and serve.

name: Almond Mocha Super Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp instant coffee dissolved in 1 tbs hot water
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Nicoise Toast
ingredients: 2 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
1 sprig of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to a rolling boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in quarters.
Spread pesto on toast and top with tuna, tomatoes, egg and olives. Season with salt and pepper and scatter over basil leaves to serve.

name: Japanese Buddha Bowl
ingredients: 1 cup (160g) microwave brown rice prepare to packet instructions
4 nori sheets broken into small pieces
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
In a small bowl whisk all marinade ingredients until well combined. Cover tofu cubes in marinade and place in refrigerator for 10 minutes to marinate.
Toss squash in oil and miso, season and place in a single layer on baking sheet. Add marinated tofu to sheet and place in the oven for 30 minutes or until golden.
Divide rice, edamame, cabbage, squash and marinated tofu between bowls. Season with furikake to serve.

name: Deconstructed Beef Tacos
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (20g) baby spinach leaves finely chopped
1 sprig of fresh cilantro finely chopped
preparation: Heat oil in medium pan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Turn the heat to high and add mince, breaking it apart while cooking.

Once meat is fully cooked add the diced tomato and paste. Mix in well and add stock and spinach. Continue cooking until liquid is almost evaporated but sauce is still moist. Adjust seasoning. Transfer to a serving bowl.
While meat is browning, make guacamole by mashing avocado, lime juice and salt together in a small bowl. Adjust seasoning.
To make salsa, mix salsa ingredients well together in a bowl.
Serve bowls of beef, salsa and guacamole with corn chips and diced cheese.

name: Tuna, Apple & Quinoa Salad Bowl
ingredients: 1 cup (180g) pre-cooked quinoa prepared according to packet directions
1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) blanched & finely shredded
185g canned tuna in brine drained & flaked
1 Pink Lady apple cored & thinly sliced
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to a rolling boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a bowl of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in half.
Divide the quinoa between serving bowls and top with kale, edamame, tuna, apple, walnuts and boiled egg. Season with salt & pepper.

name: Lunch Box Ham & Cheddar Frittata
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (60ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Melt the butter in a medium non-stick ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions get very soft, about 10-15 minutes. Spread onion on a plate to cool.
Meanwhile, whisk the eggs and milk in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper, until smooth.
Once the onions are cool, stir into the eggs with the ham, herbs and cheese.
Preheat the oven broiler to 355°F.

Reheat the non-stick skillet over low-medium heat and pour the frittata mixture into the pan, stirring to ensure the fillings are evenly arranged. Cook, stirring gently a couple times in the first minutes of cooking. Let the mixture cook undisturbed until the bottom sets, about 5 minutes.

Transfer the skillet to the oven and broil until the eggs are just set and golden brown, about 5 minutes. Take care not to overcook or the eggs will be dry. Remove from the oven, cover, and set aside for 5 minutes while you combine ingredients for yogurt dip in a small bowl. Invert the frittata onto a large plate or platter. Cut into wedges or squares and serve warm or at room temperature with dip, vegetables, crackers and fruit for a complete lunch.

name: Rice Paper Rolls with Peanut Sauce
ingredients: 3 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked, plus extra to serve
30g snow peas trimmed & thinly sliced lengthways
2 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Wrap tofu in paper towel and press under a weight to remove water. Cut tofu into 2 batons.
Heat sesame oil in a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook tofu, turning, for 2-3 minutes until golden. Set aside.
Place all the sauce ingredients in a small bowl and mix well to combine. Transfer to dipping bowl.
Dip 1 rice paper sheet in a bowl of warm water for 10 seconds, then place on a board covered with a slightly damp clean tea towel.

Place 2 mint leaves down on the end closest to you and top with a half of the lettuce, cucumber, carrot, snow peas and a piece of tofu. Fold in the sides of the sheet and roll up to enclose. Repeat. Serve with peanut dipping sauce and extra mint leaves.

name: Tempeh Falafel Salad with Mint Yogurt Sauce
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
1 sprig of fresh mint finely chopped
2 cups (60g) mixed lettuce leaves to serve
preparation: Preheat the oven to 355°F. Line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Put all the falafel ingredients in a food processor and pulse until a dough starts to form.
Shape the dough into falafel shapes or balls, and place on baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Combine the mint yogurt sauce ingredients in a bowl, mixing well.
Drizzle yogurt sauce over the warm falafels, serve with avocado and mixed lettuce.

name: Sesame Tofu Sushi Bowl
ingredients: 1⁄2 Lebanese cucumber shaved with a peeler
1 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Use tongs to quickly toast nori sheet over a low gas flame to crisp. Cool then break into smaller pieces and set aside.
Whisk dressing ingredients together.
Heat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Brush or rub tofu with sesame oil and cook for a few minutes each side until golden. Place in a shallow dish and drizzle over half the dressing.
Place rice, radish, cucumber, avocado and pea shoots in a serving bowl and drizzle over remaining dressing.
Add tofu and any marinating dressing. Top with nori and sesame seeds to serve.

name: Salmon Sushi Bowl
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (240g) microwave brown rice prepare to packet instructions
2 nori sheets cut into fine strips
3 tsp black sesame seeds or white
3 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add broccolini to frypan and cook, tossing for a few minutes.
Make dressing by mixing soy sauce and mirin together in a small bowl.
Divide rice between two bowls, top with salmon, broccolini, edamame beans, carrot, avocado, nori and sesame seeds. Season with salt and pepper, and serve with dressing.

name: Charred Broccoli & Tofu Salad
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 small red chilli pepper finely chopped
1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) chopped
preparation: Heat a non-stick grill pan or barbecue over high heat. Brush broccoli with oil and grill for 8-10 minutes, turning, until tender but still bright green. Transfer to a board and roughly chop and transfer to a bowl.
Brush tofu with maple syrup and grill alongside broccoli for 2-3 minutes a side until caramelized. Transfer to a plate.
Add quinoa, lemon zest, juice, chilli and mint to bowl of broccoli and toss well. Adjust seasoning, divide between plates and top with tofu to serve.

name: Spinach & Artichoke Bruschetta
ingredients: 2 artichoke hearts in brine drained well & roughly chopped
2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat a broiler to medium-high heat and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place spinach in a bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside until wilted. Drain, squeeze out excess water and roughly chop.
Combine cottage cheese, artichokes and scallion. Fold through spinach and season with salt and pepper.
Toast bread until lightly golden. Place on baking sheet, spread with spinach mixture and scatter over cheddar cheese. Grill for 2 minutes until melted and lightly browned. Top with arugula to serve.

name: Spinach & Feta Quesadilla
preparation: Combine salsa ingredients and season with salt and pepper.
Scatter one tortilla with spinach leaves, cheese and season with salt and pepper, then top with other tortilla.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat then gently place tortilla in the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes or until it becomes crisp. Flip and cook the other side. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Serve immediately with salsa.

name: Teriyaki Soba Noodle Salad
ingredients: 1 bunch of broccolini (5 1/2 oz bunch) ends trimmed
1⁄3 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) thinly sliced
2 tbs soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add tempeh and mushrooms and cook for a few minutes, until just beginning to brown. Cook for a few more minutes, tossing ocassionally.
Add broccolini and kale, cover and continue to cook for a few more minutes until just tender. Stir through teriyaki sauce and toss with noodles and edamame to warm through.
Transfer to bowls and top with scallion, chilli and sesame seeds.

name: Tex Mex Wrap
ingredients: 1 can of black beans (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 tsp Mexican spice mix (a mix of ground cumin, paprika & chilli pepper)
preparation: Heat a medium non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook bell pepper for 5 minutes until soft. Add corn, beans and spice mix and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes until heated through. Season with salt and pepper and remove from heat.
Spread avocado down the middle of the tortilla, top with vegetables and sprinkle with scallion, hemp seeds and cilantro. Fold the bottom of the tortilla up and wrap in the sides. Serve.

name: Banana Peanut Butter Super Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
3 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Almond Berry Super Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Soak goji berries and chia seeds in water for 10 minutes.
Combine soaked berries and chia with remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Tropical Super Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tbs macadamia nuts chopped, or other nut of choice
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Green Super Smoothie
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Choc Caramel Super Smoothie
ingredients: 1 tbs raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Squash, Barley & Lentil Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (100g) pearl barley (or quinoa if gluten-free) rinsed
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place the pumpkin on the baking sheet and rub with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and roast for 20 minutes until golden and tender.
Meanwhile, cook the pearl barley in a saucepan of salted boiling water for 25 minutes until tender. Drain.
Whisk together all the ingredients for the dressing and season with salt and pepper. Place pumpkin wedges on plates, and scatter over pearl barley, lentils, arugula and scallions.
Top with feta and pepitas to serve.

name: Panzanella Salad with Bocconcini
ingredients: 2 thick slices (2 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) cut into 1 inch cubes
200g heirloom cherry tomatoes halved, quartered or sliced depending on size
1 Lebanese cucumber halved and sliced diagonally
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked and torn
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place the bread on a baking sheet bake for 10 minutes until golden and crunchy. Cool.

In a large bowl, whisk together all ingredients for the dressing and season with salt and pepper. Add the lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, bocconcini and 3⁄4 of the basil leaves. Toss to combine. Divide between 2 serving bowls and top with bread and extra basil leaves.

name: Spiced Halloumi & Hummus Wrap
ingredients: 1 medium (3 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free)
preparation: Spread cumin on a small plate, add halloumi slices and toss to coat.
Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat, add halloumi and cook for 1-2 minutes, each side, until golden. Remove, then using same pan, add wrap and warm until golden.
To assemble wrap, spread hummus on wrap, layer with spinach leaves, cucumber, carrot and halloumi. Squeeze over lemon juice and season, roll up wrap to serve.

name: Mediterranean Roast Vegetable Sandwich
ingredients: 1⁄2 medium eggplant cut lengthways into thin slices
2 zucchini (medium) cut lengthways into thin slices
1 yellow bell pepper deseeded & cut lengthways into thin slices
4 thin slices(1 1/2 oz ea) sourdough bread (or gluten free) toasted
preparation: Heat a grill pan over medium heat. Brush vegetables with oil, add to pan and cook for 3-4 minutes each side, until starting to char and soften.
Spread pesto onto one side of toast and layer eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper and sliced bocconcini.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and top with other slice of toast. Cut in half to serve.

name: Roasted Carrot, Lentil & Almond Salad
ingredients: 1 bunch of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch)
300g plain tempeh cut into 1/2 inch slices
1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh cilantro leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking tray with baking paper.
Toss carrots and tempeh with olive oil and sprinkle with cumin, salt and pepper. Spread onto prepared tray and roast for 20-25 minutes.
Meanwhile, mix together the yogurt, vinegar, garlic and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the lentils on a serving platter and top with roasted carrots and tempeh. Dollop over yogurt dressing and top with fresh cilantro and almonds.

name: Chickpea Salad Pita Wrap
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 medium (2 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita pocket (or gluten free)
preparation: Place chickpeas, mayonnaise and lemon juice in a small bowl. Roughly mash together leaving some chickpeas whole. Add celery, scallion and parsley, season with salt and pepper and mix well to combine.
Arrange arugula down the centre of the pita bread, top with tomato and chickpea mix, wrap and serve.

name: Tofu Tacos with Tahini
ingredients: 2 large (1 1/2 oz ea) corn tortillas warmed
preparation: In a bowl season tofu with paprika, ground coriander and salt and pepper.
Heat a non-stick skillet, cook tofu for 3-5 minutes.
Place avocado in a small bowl, add lemon juice and salt and pepper, mash to combine.
In another bowl, combine all dressing ingredients together with a fork.
To assemble tacos, spread avocado on each tortilla, top with lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes and tofu and drizzle over dressing to serve.

name: Warm Grain & Kale Salad
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (90g) mixed quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1⁄2 leek white part only, thinly sliced
1 can of black beans (14 oz can) rinsed & drained
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped
1⁄2 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped & chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss carrots with half the oil and season with salt and pepper. Arrange on baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. At the same time roast pepitas for 5 minutes until toasted, then set aside.

Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Add buckwheat and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes or until toasted. Add quinoa and water, season and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain.

At the same time heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and saute leek in remaining oil for 3 minutes, tossing regularly. Add drained grains, black beans and parsley to skillet and heat through for 2 minutes.
Turn off heat, stir through kale and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine until kale has slightly wilted.
Divide between plates, and top with carrots and toasted pepitas to serve.

name: Plant-Packed Protein Sandwich
ingredients: 4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained and rinsed
preparation: Combine all protein filling ingredients together in a small bowl.
Assemble sandwich by spreading filling onto one side of bread, top with spinach, carrot and cabbage. Place second piece of bread on top and cut in half.

name: Tofu Thai Larb Lettuce Cups
ingredients: 2 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
5 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked & chopped
4 iceberg lettuce leaves or butter lettuce
preparation: Wrap tofu in paper towel and press under a weight to remove water.
Soak noodles in hot water according to packet instructions. Drain.
Heat oil in a large non-stick wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Coarsely grate tofu so it resembles mince, add to wok and cook for 5-6 minutes until golden.
Add lemongrass and chilli and stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant. Add noodles, soy sauce and mint and toss to combine. Adjust seasoning.
Divide larb between lettuce leaves and top with peanuts and a squeeze of lime juice to serve.

name: Curried ‘Egg’ Wrap
ingredients: 2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free)
preparation: Wrap tofu in paper towel and press under a weight to remove water. Transfer to a medium bowl and roughly mash with a fork. Add mayonnaise, curry powder, scallion and dill. Season with salt and pepper and mix to combine.
Place lettuce down the middle of pita wrap. Spoon over ‘egg’ mixture and fold wrap up. Serve.

name: Eggplant Salad with Lentils & Pomegranate
ingredients: 1 can of lentils (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place eggplant in a large bowl. Sprinkle over cumin, coriander and season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Transfer to baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes until golden and tender.
Place eggplant, lentils, mint and pomegranate in a large bowl and toss to combine. Transfer to serving plate and top with feta. Serve.

name: Zucchini & Tomato Flatbread Pizza
ingredients: 1 zucchini (medium) thinly sliced on a mandolin lengthways
2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free)
4 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Sprinkle zucchini with salt and stand until zucchini softens (2 minutes). Drain well and pat dry with paper towel.
In a small bowl, mix together cottage cheese, yogurt, dill and season with salt and pepper.
Place flatbread on sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes until golden and crisp around the edges.
Transfer to board and spread with cottage cheese mixture, leaving a 1⁄2-1 inch border. Top with zucchini, then tomato and sprinkle with dukkah. Cut into wedges and serve.

name: Italian Toasted Sandwich
ingredients: 4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
preparation: Preheat sandwich press.
Top half the bread with all ingredients and season with salt and pepper. Top with remaining slices and transfer to sandwich press.
Close and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden and serve.

name: Kale Salad Bowl with Poached Egg
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
75g parsnip peeled & thinly sliced into rounds
1⁄4 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) leaves stripped & chopped
1⁄2 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Toss chickpeas, parsnip and kale with oil in a bowl. Add spice, season with salt and pepper and mix well to coat. Spread onto prepared sheet and roast for 15 minutes. Sprinkle over almonds and roast for a further 5 minutes until golden. Once cooked, season and set aside to cool slightly.

Meanwhile, bring a small saucepan of water to the boil, reduce to a gentle simmer and add vinegar.  Stir in a circular motion to create a vortex and gently slide eggs into the water and cook for 4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon, pat dry and season with salt.
Transfer chickpea mixture to a serving plate, top with poached egg and avocado and season to taste.
